intro: Stachytarpheta macedoi, commonly known as the Macedonian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate in shape, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Stachytarpheta macedoi is often found in moist, open habitats such as riverbanks and forest edges.
